page.title: 17HARGRAVE-CHAPEL & BRICKWORKS
page.content: THE DISUSED METHODIST CHAPEL was built in 1870 and demolished in 1969. It was closed down through lack of people to support it. The last preacher to preach there was a MR. BULKREY. Now the land where it stood is covered with grass and brambles, which weave themselves into the last remains. These remains consist of the concrete base, some old wire and some of the corrugated iron sheets from the roof. THE HARGRAVE BRICKWORKS were built in 1898 and after periods of extension and demolition, they were finally closed in 1975. They were started by MR. MAKER, which was an appropriate name for him. The works made about 20,000 bricks each year. The land is now used for farming and for shooting game and vermin. The ruins of the works can still be seen.
